Class ObjectStorage

(line 11)

Description

 Static Method setTokenStore (line 124)
 
 

void setTokenStore(
ObjectStorage_TokenStore_Interface
$tokenStore)


	

Sets the persistent ObjectStorage authentication token storage


  1.  // ObjectStorage auth token can be reused in subsequent requests instead of each request attempts to authenticate again and again.
    2. 

  2.  $tokenStore = ObjectStorage_TokenStore::factory('file', array('ttl' => 3600, 'path' => '/tmp/objectStorage'));
    3. 

  3.  ObjectStorage::setTokenStore($tokenStore);
    4. 

  4.  
    5. 

  5.  $options = array('adapter' => ObjectStorage_Http_Client::CURL, 'timeout' => 10);
    6. 

  6.  $objectStorageDallas = new ObjectStorage($objectStorageHost, $username, $password, $options);
    7. 


		
Parameters

	
    
			
  • ObjectStorage_TokenStore_Interface $tokenStore: 
    • 
		

		
	
Info

	
    
			
  • access - public
    • 
		






 Constructor __construct (line 53)
 
 

ObjectStorage __construct(
[string
$objectStorageHost = null], [string
$username = null], [string
$password = null], [array
$options = array()])


	

ObjectStorage constructor


Instantiates a ObjectStorage object. All parameters are required except $options array.  With $options array, you can specify HTTP client adapter type. By default, CURL adapter will be used.
You can instantiate multiple ObjectStorage objects if you are dealing with a ObjectStorage cluster.
  1.  $options = array('adapter' => ObjectStorage_Http_Client::CURL, 'timeout' => 10);
    2. 

  2.  
    3. 

  3.  $objectStorageDallas = new ObjectStorage($objectStorageHost01, $username01, $password01, $options);
    4. 

  4.  
    5. 

  5.  $objectStorageSeattle = new ObjectStorage($objectStorageHost02, $username02, $password02, $options);
    6. 


		
Parameters

	
    
			
  • string $objectStorageHost: 
    • 
			
  • string $username: 
    • 
			
  • string $password: 
    • 
			
  • array $options: 
    • 
		

		
	
Info

	
    
			
  • throws - ObjectStorage_Exception_Authentication
    •

    •

 Method reloadAuthenticationData (line 171)
 
 

boolean reloadAuthenticationData(
)


	

ObjectStorage object stores an authentication token in a Token Store if configured.


If you changed your ObjectStorage password and you need to delete the old token, use this method to remove the cached token.

		
	
Info

	
    
			
  • access - public
    •

 Method with (line 208)
 
 

ObjectStorage_Abstract with(
string
$path)


	

Returns an instance of a ObjectStorage_Abstract sub-class which can be ObjectStorage_Container or ObjectStorage_Object.


A ObjectStorage_Abstract instance returned from this method will have the link to the ObjectStorage object.

		
Parameters

	
    
			
  • string $path: 
    •
